events.name: Real Blockchain Applications in Real Estate
events.description:
***RSVP is required in EVENTBRITE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/real-blockchain-applications-in-real-estate-tickets-82259338897 ***

Come learn about blockchain technology disruption in Real Estate, an industry prime to be disrupted in Miami's international market.

About this Event
Blockchain technology can be defined as an open, distributed ledger that can record transactions between two parties efficiently and in a verifiable and permanent way. Real Estate is one of the leading industries this technology is looking to disrupt and bring true innovation to. Regardless of whether you're a loan officer, real estate agent/broker, or title/escrow agent, this technology is working to speed up real estate transactions while ensuring the transfer of information is secure and the parties involved are protected. Join us as Spencer Lyon from Realdax shows you how this technology is already benefiting your business and how you take advantage of the things that can put money in your pocket today. As members of the Miami Association of Realtors, you already have the ability to work with buyers and sellers who want to use cryptocurrency for their transactions by using Realdax to support you through the process. Don't miss the chance to learn how to expand your business and clientele by understanding the ways you can work with cryptocurrency in your business today.

events.description:
About the Connecticut Blockchain Working Group:
Created by CT State Senator Scott Frantz and other members of the Commerce Committee (CT Senate Bill No. 443, Special Act No. 18-8), the working group is seeking to create legislation focused on making Connecticut a desirable state to conduct business featuring blockchain technology. Experts with knowledge in business, education, and technology are working closely with state legislators in order to create proposals that will advance the expansion of the growing blockchain industry in the state. We will also recommend policies and investments in an effort to make Connecticut a beacon for blockchain.

events.name: Bitcoin Bay Kitchener-Waterloo
events.description:
The Bitcoin Bay is Toronto’s longest running and most popular blockchain and cryptocurrency meetup. Our goal is to foster education, innovation, and networking for like-minded people in the technology & greater regional communities. We hold meetups in downtown Toronto, Mississauga, and Kitchener

Community meetups are a big part of blockchain and cryptocurrency technology. We interact with others to ask questions and talk about different ideas and projects to build a more robust ecosystem.

In the future we hope to build an inclusive, blockchain-agnostic, and flourishing community in Waterloo Region. Beyond our regional, provincial, and national borders - The Bitcoin Bay has been able to establish a flourishing WhatApp community from all over the globe. Be sure to ask about these groups to be added to them at our meetups

“If you hear somebody playing a piano, would you ever say is the piano the artist?” - Mario Klingemann -

In October 2018 an AI artwork was sold at Christie’s for $432,500.

When we think about art made by Artificial Intelligence, we imagine a bot thinking and creating art: that is not what is happening.

Artists and creators have been pushing the limits experimenting with the use of machine learning.

Is AI an emotional entity or data that is trained by human emotions?

This meetup we will dive into the "oracle problem" and what Chainlink is doing in the oracle space.

This session is welcome to any experience level, but is specifically geared towards those who have zero existing knowledge of Blockchain or DLT.

Beginners welcome! We will discuss the core concepts of distributed ledger technology (DLT) and the exciting advancements it is bringing to a variety of markets.

If you are looking for a more technical meet up, or a session geared towards developers, next month's meet up will be just that. The Arizona Chainlink meetup events will rotate monthly between beginner focused topics and more advanced sessions.

There are also many great workshops online. Many of the past events have been recorded and are ready to watch on demand, or follow the official Chainlink Twitter or Chainlink Discord channel to hear about and register for upcoming live webinars when they are scheduled.

A 6 hour intensive course, A to Z on blockchain, we cover every subject.Perfect for beginners, entrepreneurs, business leaders and blockchain enthusiast.

Online Course - Register Here: https://tinyurl.com/UserCertification

Course Syllabus:

Introduction
What is Blockchain
Blockchain Glossary
We provide 64 technical terms and definitions that relate to blockchain technology.
Why is Blockchain a revolutionary Technology
Blockchain Applications by Industry
Blockchain Transaction Model
Bitcoin & Blockchain: how are they connected
What is a Cryptocurrency
Bitcoin: A Peer to Peer Electronic Cash System
Benefits of using Blockchain Technology
Consensus
Consensus Protocol
Safety
Liveness
Fault Tolerance
Blockchain Fork
Consensus Failure
Dominance
Cheating
Poor Performance
Choosing the right blockchain
What is Cryptography
Cryptographic encryption
Elliptic-curve Cryptography (ECC)
What is Blockchain Mining (Bitcoin Examples)
The Computationally-Difficult Program
The Difficulty Metric
Block Reward
Hardware
Blockchain Business Use Cases
Private vs. Public Blockchain
Permissionless vs. Permissioned
What is Ethereum
Proof of Work
Solidity
Homestead
EthHash
Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM)
Serenity (POS)
What is Microsoft Azure Workbench Blockchain
What is Hyperledger
Hyperledger Fabric
The Practical Byzantine Fault Tolerance (PBFT)
SIEVE
Cross-Fault Tolerance (XFT)
Hyperledger SawtoothLake
Proof of Elapsed Time
Hyperledger Iroha
Hyperledger Burrow
What is Ripple & Stellar Blockchain
Ripple Consensus Protocol Algorithm
Stellar Consensus Protocol Algorithm
What is a Smart contract
What is Proof of Stake
What is the EOS blockchain
Proof of Stake
EOS Vs. Ethereum
Denial of Service Attacks
Consensus Mechanism & Governance
What is Bitshares Blockchain & DEX
Delegated Proof of Stake (DPOS)
Transaction Confirmation
Proof of Stake Consensus
Block Production by Elected Witnesses
Parameter Change by Elected Delegates
Changing the Rules (aka Hard Forks)
Double Spend Attack

We will provide an online exam to provide your final grade and certificate of completion.

events.name: UnBlockingChain#6 - Cloud con Oracle  - Telefónica Trust OS - Experto Blockchain
events.description:
Unblocking Chain #6
Jueves 12 de Diciembre 2019. Sala 2.04 / Salón de Actos a 17:00 h

1. Plataforma Blockchain como Servicio Cloud con Oracle.
2. Telefónica Trust OS y Casos de éxito de Blockchain.
3. Presentación del II Título de Experto Universitario en Tecnologías de Blockchain.

En esta sesión conoceremos de primera mano las soluciones de blockchain de grandes empresas tecnológicas como Oracle y Telefónica (11Paths).
Estas soluciones están orientadas a una adopción e integración más fácil de la tecnología Blockchain, así como a una transformación más eficaz y profesional de los procesos y aplicaciones de cualquier negocio, permitiendo un procesamiento más rápido de las transacciones.

Contaremos con la participación de:
- Antonio Gómez, Principal Solution Engineer de Oracle:
https://www.linkedin.com/in/antonio-gomez-rodriguez-7832a4a/

- Marcos Arjona, Cybersecurity Innovation & Research Booster de Telefónica - ElevenPaths:
https://www.linkedin.com/in/marcosarjona/

Tanto Antonio como Marcos formarán parte del plantel de profesores del "II Título Propio de Experto Universitario en Tecnologías de Blockchain", que dará comienzo a finales de Enero:
https://www.nics.uma.es/Blockchain
También durante esta sesión, Javier López, director de este Título de Experto de la UMA, realizará una presentación de los contenidos y temporización de esta segunda edición.

events.name: [Hashed Lounge #25] The Year-End Meetup
events.description:
# Hashed Lounge 소개

Hashed Lounge는 전세계 블록체인 시장의 혁신적인 기술과 프로젝트를 커뮤니티에 소개하고 교류하는 밋업입니다. 탈중앙화된 미래를 꿈꾸는 많은 분들과 함께 재미있는 커뮤니티를 만들어가고 싶습니다.

[Hashed Community Channels]

Hashed Medium (ENG): https://medium.com/hashed-official
Hashed Medium (KOR): https://medium.com/hashed-kr
Hashed Telegram: https://t.me/hashedchannel
Hashed Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/hashedfund

# Hashed Lounge: The Year-End Meetup에 초대합니다!

2019년 한 해 동안 해시드는 블록체인 시장에서 어떤 기회들을 발견했을까요? 그리고 앞으로 다가오는 2020년에는 무슨 일들이 기다리고 있을까요? 해시드는 하루가 다르게 발전하는 블록체인 기술이 곧 우리 삶의 많은 부분에 접목되고, 미래사회의 중요한 축이 될 것이라고 믿고 있습니다. 이번 행사에 함께하셔서 해시드가 바라보는 미래의 모습을 함께 살펴보고 이야기 나누었으면 합니다.

# 행사 프로그램

7:00 PM ~ 7:05 PM: Opening Remarks, 김서준 대표
7:05 PM ~ 7:25 PM: 블록체인 게임시장의 현황, 김균태 파트너
7:25 PM ~ 7:35 PM: NOD Games, 이찬기 대표
7:35 PM ~ 7:55 PM: CeFi 101, 김성호 파트너
7:55 PM ~ 8:15 PM: 디파이(DeFi)에 주목해야 하는 이유, 김경진 심사역
8:15 PM ~ 8:35 PM: Panel Session
8:35 PM ~ 9:00 PM: 네트워킹

# Meetup 참가 안내

• 장소: 해시드 라운지 (서울특별시 강남구 테헤란로 4길14 미림타워 3층)
• 시간: 2019년 12월 17일 화요일, 19:00 ~ 21:00
• 인원: 100명
• 참가비: 무료

- 본 행사는 한국어로 진행되며, 별도의 통역이 없습니다.
- 본 행사에서는 간단한 음식이 준비되어 있습니다.
- 참가 등록이 확정되신 분들에 한해서 참석 가능합니다.

RSVP on meetup does not guarantee an entry to this event. To attend the event, you need to sign-up on Eventbrite.

Signing up on meetup does not guarantee an entry to the event.

events.name: Hyperledger Blockchain [frameworks and use-cases] Meetup
events.description:
We will discuss the general topic of Blockchain for beginner in the first half of the disucssion.

Then we will make an introductory to Hyperledger Blockchain Frameworks and what are the different use-cases used for each framework.

This will be a good opportunity for you to become familiar with Hyperledger Organization and it's frameworks. Most important the amazing efforts being contributed to building these frameworks for opensource.

If you are interested to learn about Blockchain Networks and would like to get a better understanding then this workshop is for you!

This will also be a good chance for us to have a discussion around the benefits of the technology for our country with current developments. And I personally am excited to meet some of you for the first time.

events.name: Blazor & WebAssembly
events.description:
Blazor is the answer of Microsoft to create modern and flexible web applications. Blazor belongs to the opensource AspNetCore framework. What makes Blazor special? We think the possibility to build WebAssemblies, the ability to code in C# instead of JavaScript and the server and client mode.
Martin Kräuchi will show you the key elements of Blazor in a practical step by step approach (no C# knowledge necessary). By interest he also will give us a glimpse to azure storage queues and azure serverless computing (azure functions).
Bring in your laptop, food and drinks are offered. Usually we hack until 10-11 p.m. creating some kind of more or less meaningful applications. Feel free to join us as long as your batteries allow :)

events.name: Google AI Tech Talk: Building real time cross platform video audio ML pipelines
events.description:
Join us this Google AI tech talk event:

Topic:
MediaPipe: Building real time cross platform video audio ML pipelines

Abstract:
Video, audio (multimodal) mobile and edge use cases that utilize machine learning models (eg Tiktok, Shazam, Google Home Hub) are becoming more common. However, creating these multimodal ML applications are challenging as developers need to deal with real time synchronization of time series data during model inference and doing it cross platform on mobile and edge devices.
Google open sourced in Jun 2019, MediaPipe (https://mediapipe.dev), a cross platform applied machine learning pipeline framework that simplifies the development process. My talk will be introducing open source MediaPipe framework, walking through mobile and edge (EdgeTPU coral) demos and getting developers started on building multimodal ML applications

https://mediapipe.page.link/handgoogleaiblog

Speaker:
Ming Yong is a Product manager in Google Research Perception Research leading open source efforts in computer vision. In Google, he was previously product manager in Google Search and product lead for mobile video ad formats. Before Google, Ming was cofounder Socialwok, an enterprise collaboration service for Google Apps (Finalist of the Techcrunch Disrupt 2011) and Voiceroute, a startup focused on open source VOIP telephony services for small medium enterprises.

Direction:
The meeting room is on 3rd floor, Beach Huts

events.description:
Details
The Agenda: Instant Crypto Remittance catching up Worldwide.

Bitcoin & Cryptocurrency's Most Effective Use: The $600 Billion Global Remittance

India is expected to retain the top spot among remittance recipients, with a projected figure of $65 billion, while China ($63 billion), the Philippines ($33 billion), Mexico ($31 billion), and Nigeria ($22 billion) hold the next spots on the list.

A peer-to-peer system known as blockchain is responsible for running Bitcoin and Cryptocurrency. Transactions using the digital currency are recorded in the ledger, and no one entity is tasked with managing it. Essentially, when a transaction occurs, the records on the ledger adjust accordingly.

The World Bank estimates that 10% of global remittance is eaten up in fees. That’s a scandalously high figure and must be reduced. We sincerely hope that distributed ledger technologies will move us towards a seamless, legal and inexpensive way to transmit this value using InstaCrypto and our users can profit from it. The profit is seen most times because crypto is at a premium in india consistently. But for now, we need to work with this constraint — any disruption to the status quo only makes sense if it delivers a fee load lower than 10% of value transmitted.
